etymologies: late Middle English: from late Latin, neuter of reptilis, from Latin rept- ‘crawled’, from the verb repere

definitions: a vertebrate animal of a class that includes snakes, lizards, crocodiles, turtles, and tortoises. They are distinguished by having a dry scaly skin and typically laying soft-shelled eggs on land.

notes.text: Class Reptilia: orders Chelonia (turtles and tortoises), Squamata (snakes and lizards), Rhynchocephalia (the tuatara), and Crocodylia (crocodilians). Modern reptiles are cold-blooded, though among extinct groups, including dinosaurs, pterosaurs, and ichthyosaurs, some may have been warm-blooded

shortDefinitions: vertebrate animal of class that includes snakes, lizards, crocodiles and tortoises

definitions: a person regarded with loathing and contempt

examples.text: are you contradicting me, you ignorant little reptile?

shortDefinitions: person regarded with loathing and contempt

definitions: belonging to a reptile or to the class of reptiles
shortDefinitions: belonging to reptile or to class of reptiles
